channel.title: HH eNews 20240410 Prostate cancer rates to double by 2040 | Electronic socks, unhealthy walking and diabetes | What's the key to retaining rural GPs? | Oral vaccine for UTI | Plus products
channel.description: In this issue: Global prostate cancer rates predicted to double by 2040

item.title: Hand Sanitisers in healthcare: a hygienic retrospect for a healthy future
item.description: Looking back four years, the COVID-19 pandemic caught us unexpectedly and triggered a global crisis and profound changes in public health.

item.title: Do People Or Processes Cause Healthcare Mistakes?
item.description: Healthcare is a critical industry where the consequences of even the slightest mistake can be fatal. As a result, there is always an abundance of blame to pass around when things go wrong.

item.title: Para Mobility: Transforming lives with assistive lifting technology
item.description: For over 40 years, one of the industry-leading Australian-based companies, Para Mobility continues to leverage its profound understanding of the unique accessibility needs of people with disabilities to innovate custom-designed assistive tools such as hoists, wall-mounted changing tables, and aquatic chairs.

item.title: Global prostate cancer rates predicted to double by 2040
item.description: The number of annual prostate cancer deaths worldwide is predicted to rise by 85% from 375,000 in 2020 to almost 700,000 by 2040.

item.title: What's the key to retaining rural GPs?
item.description: Understanding doctors' decisions to stay or leave, once recruited, could provide insights on how to address GP shortages in rural and remote areas.

item.title: A Day in the Life of Sarah Morse
item.description: From working as a health advisor at a safe house for human trafficking survivors to a palliative care nurse, Sarah Morse has over two decades of nursing experience.

item.title: Smart socks detect unhealthy walking style
item.description: An electronic sock hopes to improve prevention of foot ulcers and amputation, benefiting patients with diabetes.

item.title: UTI vaccines could prevent infection for nine years
item.description: MV140 is a new vaccine for recurrent UTIs and is administered with two sprays of a pineapple-flavoured suspension under the tongue every day for three months.

item.title: Accreditation Matters 2024
item.description: Gain insights, explore accreditation’s vital role in industry success and equip yourself with the knowledge to stay ahead in a rapidly evolving world. This is your opportunity to be part of a two-day conference that offers significant networking and professional development opportunities and will elevate your understanding and impact in the realm of accreditation.

item.title: Neat Frame video conferencing device
item.description: The Neat Frame is an 'all-in-one' portable video conferencing device featuring personal, portrait-orientated HD video framing technology and front-facing speakers to deliver a rich sound quality.

item.title: Nilfisk GD930 Pro HEPA vacuum
item.description: The upgraded Nilfisk GD930 Pro HEPA vacuum is designed to help users to clean faster and efficiently.

item.title: Surgical Order SOx logistics platform
item.description: SOx has developed an intuitive platform improving the surgical workflow and communication between surgeons, hospitals and suppliers with an aim to tackle the challenges of a disconnected ecosystem.

item.title: Camfil Hi-Flo energy-efficient filters
item.description: The filters are designed to remove airborne contaminants such as smoke, bacteria, fumes, fungi and virus-bearing droplet nuclei.

item.title: SDX Thermobox
item.description: is a reliable partner to professional chefs and kitchens for over 50 years. A complete range for all your bulk and plated food delivery needs.

item.title: AIR LIQUIDE HEALTHCARE
item.description: Air Liquide Healthcare is Australia’s leading supplier of medical gases. For more information, call our friendly customer service team on 1300 36 02 02 or visit our website
